# Project: Claude Code Mastery Bootcamp - Cohort 4 Curriculum

## Program Overview

**Format**: 4-week intensive, 2 sessions per week (8 total)
**Duration**: 2 hours per session
**Cohort Size**: 12 participants max
**Price**: $2,500 per participant
**Next Cohort**: February 3 - February 28, 2026

## Learning Objectives

By the end of this bootcamp, participants will be able to:
1. Design and implement all 6 Claude Code primitive types
2. Apply AI-native development principles to real projects
3. Build a personal primitive library for their workflow
4. Evaluate and improve existing AI workflows

## Session Outline

### Week 1: Foundations

**Session 1: The AI-Native Mindset**
- Why AI-native matters now
- The 7 principles of AI-native development
- Claude Code architecture overview
- Lab: Set up Claude Code environment

**Session 2: Slash Commands Deep Dive**
- Anatomy of a slash command
- YAML frontmatter essentials
- Tool selection strategies
- Lab: Build 3 slash commands for your workflow

### Week 2: Building Blocks

**Session 3: Skills - Complex Workflows**
- When commands become skills
- Multi-step workflow design
- User interaction patterns
- Lab: Convert a complex process into a skill

**Session 4: Subagents - Specialized Intelligence**
- Subagent architecture patterns
- Explorer, Specialist, Validator patterns
- Managing subagent scope
- Lab: Design a code review subagent

### Week 3: Integration & Automation

**Session 5: Hooks - Event-Driven AI**
- Hook triggers and lifecycle
- Pre and post event patterns
- Validation and guardrails
- Lab: Implement pre-commit quality hooks

**Session 6: MCP Servers - External Integration**
- MCP protocol fundamentals
- Building data connectors
- Security considerations
- Lab: Connect to an external API via MCP

### Week 4: Mastery & Application

**Session 7: Workflow Composition**
- Combining primitives effectively
- Error handling strategies
- Testing AI workflows
- Lab: Build an end-to-end workflow

**Session 8: Capstone & Graduation**
- Capstone project presentations
- Peer feedback and review
- Maintaining and evolving primitives
- Certification and next steps

## Assessment

### Participation (30%)
- Attend all 8 sessions
- Engage in discussions and labs
- Provide peer feedback

### Labs (40%)
- Complete all 7 lab exercises
- Submit working primitives
- Document design decisions

### Capstone Project (30%)
- Design a 3+ primitive workflow
- Present to cohort (10 minutes)
- Incorporate feedback from Sessions 1-7

## Materials Provided

- Comprehensive workbook (100+ pages)
- Template library for all primitive types
- Access to private Discord community
- 30-day post-bootcamp support
- Certificate of completion

## Prerequisites

- 2+ years software development experience
- Familiarity with CLI tools
- Claude Code installed and configured
- Completed pre-work assessment (1 hour)
